programme.title: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon
programme.desc: The long-running late-night talk show returns to New York for the first time since 1972 when comic Jimmy Fallon takes over hosting duties, accompanied by his Grammy-winning house band, The Roots. The former cast member of "Saturday Night Live" and lead of a later show welcomes guests to an evening of comedy, music, conversation and competitions. Lorne Michaels serves as the programme's executive producer.

programme.title: Finding Solutions
programme.desc: 'Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls.' Goal five of the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals has a clear target, but how achievable is it before 2030? This episode brings together four women who are fighting to make sure it happens. From the UN to Royalty and a bit of 'Glamour' as well. CNBC's Tania Bryer explores what we can all do to help achieve the UN's SDG 5.

programme.title: The CNBC Conversation
programme.desc: CNBC's Joumanna Bercetche speaks to Accor CEO, Sébastien Bazin about COVID-19's impact on the multinational hotel group, the road to recovery for the hospitality industry and reducing the company's environmental impact.

programme.title: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon
programme.desc: The long-running late-night talk show returns to New York for the first time since 1972 when comic Jimmy Fallon takes over hosting duties, accompanied by his Grammy-winning house band, The Roots. The former cast member of "Saturday Night Live" and lead of a later show welcomes guests to an evening of comedy, music, conversation and competitions. Lorne Michaels serves as the programme's executive producer.

programme.title: Finding Solutions
programme.desc: 'Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls.' Goal five of the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals has a clear target, but how achievable is it before 2030? This episode brings together four women who are fighting to make sure it happens. From the UN to Royalty and a bit of 'Glamour' as well. CNBC's Tania Bryer explores what we can all do to help achieve the UN's SDG 5.

programme.title: The CNBC Conversation
programme.desc: CNBC's Joumanna Bercetche speaks to Accor CEO, Sébastien Bazin about COVID-19's impact on the multinational hotel group, the road to recovery for the hospitality industry and reducing the company's environmental impact.

programme.title: Managing Asia
programme.desc: As the virus pandemic threatens to turn into a hunger pandemic, Sunny Verghese of Olam International tells Christine Tan how the agri-food giant is helping farmers battle at the front lines and cope with the disruptive shocks along the food chain.

programme.title: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon
programme.desc: The long-running late-night talk show returns to New York for the first time since 1972 when comic Jimmy Fallon takes over hosting duties, accompanied by his Grammy-winning house band, The Roots. The former cast member of "Saturday Night Live" and lead of a later show welcomes guests to an evening of comedy, music, conversation and competitions. Lorne Michaels serves as the programme's executive producer.
